body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation             Directions & Transportation          By Car Saint Croix Island International Historic Site is best reached by private vehicle. The site is located 8 miles (13 km) south of Calais, Maine, on US Route 1, and can be reached either by Route 9 from Bangor or US Route 1, the coastal route from Portland and points south. From US Route 1, turn onto St. Croix Drive. The entrance gate is on the right. The visitor center is inside the ranger station.          GPS For drivers using GPS, the site's physical address is 84 Saint Croix Drive, Calais, Maine 04619.         By Plane Several different airlines service airports at Bangor, Maine (103 miles, 166 km), or Saint John, New Brunswick, Canada (80 miles, 129 km). Car rentals are available at both airports.         By Boat The only visitor access to the island is by privately owned boats. Visits to the island are not encouraged due to its fragile nature.       Maps           Site Map showing visitor facilities at Saint Croix Island International Historic Site          Area map showing driving routes.         Locator Map of New England and New Brunswick.         Saint Croix Map and Information
